Posts.Content: Hi all, So I have an appointment tomorrow for an examination at my local hospital as I’ve found a lump on my left breast. Well... when I say I’ve found one... I’ve been checked over in the same spot previously and been told “Oh, you’re naturally just lumpy”... Nice. This time though it feels a little different and here’s why: Every so often I get a sharp, stinging pain where the lump is, almost like I’m being pinched. Again, every so often I get a dull ache there. The other day I went to put a piece of food in my mouth but it fell out of my hand. Natural instinct was to quickly put my elbows by my side to stop it falling and that really hurt. Proper caught myself.  I know my body and I know when something isn’t quite right. I’m expecting them to say the same as before or that it’s just hormones but I don’t think I’ll be quite happy with that this time around. Let me say that I’m not expecting anything major but I just feel like I’ll need extra clarification.  Not only that I think I have an appointment with a man...
Posts.Title: Appointment tomorrow... Bit Nervy
